description.narrative: Contribute to the sustainable improvement in the quality of electricity services to customers and to the strengthening of the financial and operational performance of the electricity public utility (EDH).

condition.narrative: Cause the Strategic Steering Committee to convene its first meeting not later than two weeks after the Effective Date and,thereafte r, quarterly during the course of Project implementation
Ensure that MEF shall furnish to the Association a written report with supporting documents, about the status of its payments to EDH
Plan with minimum electricity supply of hours per day that MEF intends to finance
ensure that PTU-EDH and PCU submit work plans and budget to the Association for its review and approval

comment.narrative: Baseline has to be reset post earthquake
Value has to be reset post the earthquake.
Survey to be done once the information systems operation is judged satisfactory to EDH.
Baseline has to be reset post earthquake
Value has to be reset post the earthquake.
As of March 2012, 180,315 customers for 1987 employees.

title.narrative: Successful training of MTPTC staff to supervise performance indicators

comment.narrative: Baseline is set on the day of effectiveness of the additional financing, which finances the MTPTC staff

actual.value: Three staff are now working in the unit.

comment.narrative: Value has to be reset post earthquake
Value expected in April 2013, as an OIA (Tetra Tech) objective.
Important variations, due to a fragile commercial environment.

title.narrative: Number of EDH employees trained to attend and follow up on large customers

comment.narrative: Value has to be set post earthquake
Value has to be set to take into account impact of the earthquake on customer database - which is being updated now.
16 employees trained, of which 5 for large public clients.

title.narrative: Small customers served at least six hours a day on average

comment.narrative: Value has to be set post earthquake
All circuits with more than 6h/d in March 2012 (lowest at 7.83h/d).

title.narrative: Percentage of large customers served at least 12 hours per day on average

comment.narrative: Value has to be set post earthquake
Not measured yet, remote meters will provide information in end 2012
Value has to be set post earthquake
Not provided by EDH - CMS under implementation will provide data.

title.narrative: Percentage of customers served at least 6 hours per day on average in the zones served by EDH

comment.narrative: Value has to be set post earthquake.
Lowest is 7.83h/day.Important variations, due to a fragile power system.

title.narrative: 1.3. Number of EDH employees trained to use CMS and TSMS (not cumulative)

comment.narrative: 278 trained on CMS and 18 trained on TSMS (Hotline front desk).
Value has to be reset post the earthquake.
CMS operational, all metropolitan area clients managed under this system since 01 March 2012.
First wave of implementation of the system will take place in mid 2012 with 5,000 clients, via TSMS system.
Value has to be set to take into account impact of the earthquake on customer database - which is being updated now.
Regularization of all 1270 large customers (formerly 2100 large customers, others being removed from this category).

title.narrative: Number of EDH employees satisfied with the project

comment.narrative: Surveys have not yet taken place, given that the systems have just been implemented.

title.narrative: 1.2. Number of customers in TSMS database

comment.narrative: Value has to be reset post the earthquake.
TSMS in a test phase until May 2012. All EDH clients database to be integrated after the national deployment..

baseline.value: No financial management plan in place

target.value: Implementation of (i) an accounting system, (ii) definition of manual of procedures, and (iii) inventory of assets with supportfrom accounting assistance.

actual.value: RFP for the accounting assistance launched in January 2012. A firm to be awarded, results expected in end-2012..

comment.narrative: The plan is to be implemented with the support of an accounting firm to be hired by EDH.

target.value: Implementation of new procedures for: - Financial Management - Internal Control - Human Resources - Technical Management

actual.value: Diffusion of commercial and performance culture within EDH staff, in addition to the supervision of new tools learning phases.

comment.narrative: Additional support from Tetra Tech (March 2012 to April 2013). Tetra Tech to indicate experts complementary roles.
